Class AdminAccount

java.lang.Object
accounts.RefereeAccount
accounts.AdminAccount
public class AdminAccount extends RefereeAccount

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    AdminAccount(int id, String emailAddress, String password)
    The assign referee method allows referees to be assigned to matches, this is important as the referee accounts can only record matches that they are assigned to.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    void
    assignManagerToTeam(Connection connection, Team team, Manager manager, String contract)
    The assign manager to team method enables the player to be registered as one of the teams employees and enables that manager to access the players of that team through their manager panel in the 'Your View' section of the application where the manager can change the players shirt number.
    void
    assignPlayerToTeam(Connection connection, Team team, Player player, String contract)
    The assign player to team method enables the player to be registered as one of the teams employees and can record goals and other match events for both teams and the players with ease.
    void
    assignRef(Connection connection, Match match, Referee ref)
    The assign referee method allows referees to be assigned to matches, this is important as the referee accounts can only record matches that they are assigned to.

    The assign stadium method allows referees to be assigned to teams.

    Change league name method allows for customisation of the application and the league that the admin is managing.

    Adds manager person into the managers table, along with their userId when their account is created.
    void
    createManagerAccount(Connection connection, String fname, String lname)
    Adds manager account into the userAccounts table, then goes on to create a new manager in the managers table using the createManager method.

    Creates a match row to be added to the matches table of the database.

    Adds referee person into the referees table.
    void
    createRefereeAccount(Connection connection, String fname, String lname, String city)
    Adds referee account into the userAccounts table, then goes on to create a new referee in the referees table using the createReferee method.
    void
    createSeason(Connection connection, String start, String end)
    Searches database for a season that has been assigned as the current season, if there is a season assigned as the current one, the new season is created and sets isCurrent to false, however if there is no current season already, this season being created is assigned as current.
    void
    createSeasonMatches(JFGPdb db, List<Team> teams, Season season)
    Following method is the logic used to create alternating home and away games for a team, as well as creating the second fixture between two teams in the second half of the season when the teams swap being home and away.

    Allows the admin to tell the system which season is the season that is currently being played or the season that is due to be started.
    void
    unassignManagerFromTeam(Connection connection, Manager manager)
    Unassign manager from team method refers to the team employee table, locates the manager by ID and consequently deletes that row from the teamEmployee table; the teamEmployeeId in the respective managers table is then set to NULL as a result of an ON DELETE clause in the database table initialisation.
    void
    unassignPlayerFromTeam(Connection connection, Player player)
    Unassign player from team method refers to the team employee table, locates the manager by ID and consequently deletes that row from the teamEmployee table; the teamEmployeeId in the respective players table is then set to NULL as a result of an ON DELETE clause in the database table initialisation.

    getReferee, matchEventDialog, matchToResult, recordMatchEvents

  • Constructor Details

    • AdminAccount

      public AdminAccount(int id, String emailAddress, String password)
      The assign referee method allows referees to be assigned to matches, this is important as the referee accounts can only record matches that they are assigned to.
      Parameters:
      id - The ID of the user account in the user accounts table of the database.
      emailAddress - The email address associated with the instance account.
      password - The password associated with the instance account.

  • Method Details

    • assignRef

      public void assignRef(Connection connection, Match match, Referee ref)
      The assign referee method allows referees to be assigned to matches, this is important as the referee accounts can only record matches that they are assigned to.
      Parameters:
      connection - The connection to the database must be passed on in order for the methods to interact safely with the database.
      match - Match that is having a referee assigned to it.
      ref - Referee being assigned to the match.

    • assignStadium

      public void assignStadium(Connection connection, Team team, Stadium stadium)
      The assign stadium method allows referees to be assigned to teams. This is then the stadium that is referred to when the team is playing a match at their home ground as the match location.
      Parameters:
      connection - The connection to the database must be passed on in order for the methods to interact safely with the database.
      team - Team that is having a stadium assigned to it.
      stadium - Stadium being assigned as the home ground for the team.

    • assignPlayerToTeam

      public void assignPlayerToTeam(Connection connection, Team team, Player player, String contract)
      The assign player to team method enables the player to be registered as one of the teams employees and can record goals and other match events for both teams and the players with ease.
      Parameters:
      connection - The connection to the database must be passed on in order for the methods to interact safely with the database.
      team - The team that is having the player assigned to it.
      player - Player being assigned to a team.
      contract - The type of contract that the player has at the team (full-time/ part-time).

    • assignManagerToTeam

      public void assignManagerToTeam(Connection connection, Team team, Manager manager, String contract)
      The assign manager to team method enables the player to be registered as one of the teams employees and enables that manager to access the players of that team through their manager panel in the 'Your View' section of the application where the manager can change the players shirt number.
      Parameters:
      connection - The connection to the database must be passed on in order for the methods to interact safely with the database.
      team - The team that is having the manager assigned to it.
      manager - Manager being assigned to a team.
      contract - The type of contract that the player has at the team (full-time/ part-time).

    • unassignManagerFromTeam

      public void unassignManagerFromTeam(Connection connection, Manager manager)
      Unassign manager from team method refers to the team employee table, locates the manager by ID and consequently deletes that row from the teamEmployee table; the teamEmployeeId in the respective managers table is then set to NULL as a result of an ON DELETE clause in the database table initialisation.
      Parameters:
      connection - Connection to the database in order to safely interact with it.
      manager - The manager being unassigned from the team that they are currently assigned to.

    • unassignPlayerFromTeam

      public void unassignPlayerFromTeam(Connection connection, Player player)
      Unassign player from team method refers to the team employee table, locates the manager by ID and consequently deletes that row from the teamEmployee table; the teamEmployeeId in the respective players table is then set to NULL as a result of an ON DELETE clause in the database table initialisation.
      Parameters:
      connection - Connection to the database in order to safely interact with it.
      player - The player being unassigned from the team that they are currently assigned to.

    • createSeasonMatches

      public void createSeasonMatches(JFGPdb db, List<Team> teams, Season season)
      Following method is the logic used to create alternating home and away games for a team, as well as creating the second fixture between two teams in the second half of the season when the teams swap being home and away.
      Parameters:
      db - The database object itself rather than the connection, this is because the db class contains a method to retrieve teams by their team ID and this is necessary to add the bye-week team to the teams list if there are an odd number of teams.
      teams - The teams selected to participate in the season and therefore need to have matches scheduled for them.
      season - The season that the selected teams will be playing in.

    • changeLeagueName

      public void changeLeagueName(Connection connection, String newName)
      Change league name method allows for customisation of the application and the league that the admin is managing.
      Parameters:
      connection - Connection to the database in order to safely interact with it.
      newName - The new inputted name for the league

    • setCurrentSeason

      public void setCurrentSeason(Connection connection, int seasonId)
      Allows the admin to tell the system which season is the season that is currently being played or the season that is due to be started.
      Parameters:
      connection - Connection to the database in order to safely interact with it.
      seasonId - The season being set as active/current

    • removeManager

      public void removeManager(Connection connection, Manager manager)
      Removes manager as a person from the database and then goes on to remove their account from the database too, this ensures that the manager no longer has access to the system with manager access.
      Parameters:
      connection - Connection to the database ensuring safe interaction with it.
      manager - Manager to be removed.

    • createManager

      public void createManager(Connection connection, String fname, String lname, int id)
      Adds manager person into the managers table, along with their userId when their account is created.
      Parameters:
      connection - Connection to the database ensuring safe interaction with it.
      fname - Managers first name.
      lname - Managers last name.
      id - User ID associated with managers account for accessing the system.

    • createManagerAccount

      public void createManagerAccount(Connection connection, String fname, String lname)
      Adds manager account into the userAccounts table, then goes on to create a new manager in the managers table using the createManager method.
      Parameters:
      connection - Connection to the database ensuring safe interaction with it.
      fname - Managers first name.
      lname - Managers last name.

    • createTeam

      public void createTeam(Connection connection, String teamName)
      Creates a row in teams table of database for new team.
      Parameters:
      connection - Connection to the database.
      teamName - Name of team being added.

    • removeTeam

      public void removeTeam(Connection connection, Team team)
      Removes a row in teams table of database associated with a team.
      Parameters:
      connection - Connection to the database.
      team - Team being removed.

    • createPlayer

      public void createPlayer(Connection connection, String fname, String lname, String positionType)
      Adds player person into the players table.
      Parameters:
      connection - Connection to the database ensuring safe interaction with it.
      fname - Players first name.
      lname - Players last name.
      positionType - The position that the player plays in most often.

    • removePlayer

      public void removePlayer(Connection connection, Player player)
      Removes player person from the players table.
      Parameters:
      connection - Connection to the database ensuring safe interaction with it.
      player - Instance of the player that is to be removed from the database.

    • removeReferee

      public void removeReferee(Connection connection, Referee ref)
      Removes referee person from the referees table.
      Parameters:
      connection - Connection to the database ensuring safe interaction with it.
      ref - Instance of the referee that is to be removed from the database.

    • createReferee

      public void createReferee(Connection connection, String fname, String lname, String city, int id)
      Adds referee person into the referees table.
      Parameters:
      connection - Connection to the database ensuring safe interaction with it.
      fname - Referees first name.
      lname - Referees last name.
      city - The city that the referee is based in - would be used for deciding which matches they officiate.
      id - UserID associated with the referee being created.

    • createRefereeAccount

      public void createRefereeAccount(Connection connection, String fname, String lname, String city)
      Adds referee account into the userAccounts table, then goes on to create a new referee in the referees table using the createReferee method.
      Parameters:
      connection - Connection to the database ensuring safe interaction with it.
      fname - Referees first name.
      lname - Referees last name.
      city - The city that the referee is based in - would be used for deciding which matches they officiate.

    • createSeason

      public void createSeason(Connection connection, String start, String end)
      Searches database for a season that has been assigned as the current season, if there is a season assigned as the current one, the new season is created and sets isCurrent to false, however if there is no current season already, this season being created is assigned as current.
      Parameters:
      connection - Connection to the database ensuring safe interaction with it.
      start - Start year for the season.
      end - End year for the season.

    • removeSeason

      public void removeSeason(Connection connection, Season season)
      Removes instance of a stadium from the database.
      Parameters:
      connection - Connection to the database ensuring safe interaction with it.
      season - Instance of a season that is to be removed from the database.

    • createMatch

      public void createMatch(Connection connection, Team homeTeam, Team awayTeam, Season season, int matchWeek)
      Creates a match row to be added to the matches table of the database.
      Parameters:
      connection - Connection to the database ensuring safe interaction with it.
      homeTeam - Home team for the match.
      awayTeam - Away team for the match.
      season - Season that the match is going to be played in.
      matchWeek - The week that the match will be played.

    • createStadium

      public void createStadium(Connection connection, String name, String cap, String loc)
      Creates stadium to be added to the stadiums table of the database.
      Parameters:
      connection - Connection to the database ensuring safe interaction with it.
      name - Name of the stadium being added to the database.
      cap - Capacity of the stadium being added.
      loc - Location of the stadium/city that stadium is based in.

    • removeStadium

      public void removeStadium(Connection connection, Stadium stadium)
      Removes stadium from the stadiums table.
      Parameters:
      connection - Connection to the database ensuring safe interaction with it.
      stadium - Instance of a stadium that is to be removed from the database.
